pal 0.0.9050
  • Reference

Print x as newline-separated character vector using cat().

Source: R/pal-GEN.R
cat_lines.Rd

Convenience wrapper around as_chr() and cat(), mainly intended for interactive use.

cat_lines(...)

Arguments

...

The R object(s) to print. Dynamic dots are supported.

Value

None (invisible NULL).

See also

cli::cat_line() for a faster alternative that doesn't recursively convert its input to type character.

xfun::raw_string() (and xfun::file_string()) for an alternative approach to the same use case (but without any conversion to type character at all).

Other string functions: as_chr(), as_string(), dsv_colnames(), escape_lf(), fuse_regex(), prettify_nr(), prose_ls(), str_replace_file(), str_replace_verbose(), wrap_chr()

Examples

fs::path_package(package = "pal",
                 "DESCRIPTION") %>%
  readr::read_lines() %>%
  cat_lines()

# recursive conversion to type character or not
to_convert <-
  list(tibble::tibble(a = 1:3), "A", factor("wonderful"), xfun::strict_list("day")) %T>%
  print()

#> [[1]]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A"
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] wonderful
#> Levels: wonderful
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "day"
#> 
#> 

to_convert %>% cat_lines()

#> 1
#> 2
#> 3
#> A
#> wonderful
#> day
to_convert %>% cli::cat_line()

#> list(a = 1:3)
#> A
#> 1
#> list("day")
